c-0: ^ You have been born into existence.

starting_scene: ^You are in a stream in the highlands. You can swim around and explore the environment.

s: ^Talk to the small fish around you

c-0: ^The water is clear and sparkling. The stream burbles.
c-1: ^The stream is lined with lush evergreen forests, their needles swaying in the spring breeze. Some flower petals float by. You see birds chirping and flitting around.
c-2: ^You are literally baby and have no concept of communication. Instead you make some cute sounds.

downstream: ^You swim downstream. You are quickly carried away by the current.

g-0: ^You are not strong enough to go back.
g-1: ^You let the current carry you downstream.

^Vast landscapes flash by. From the mountains, to forests, to rolling plains. You catch glimpses of society in the distance, ominous smokestacks billowing dark clouds. Everythin goes too quickly for you to focus on one particular thing.
g-3: ^Suddenly, you are flying over a waterfall. You are buffeted by the rocks at the bottom. You catch a glimpse of the vast, dark blue sea before you pass out.
g-4: ^Camera goes to you lying in the ocean, slowly floating around all alone. The dark waters dimly reflect the twinkling night sky. The camera slowly zooms out.
g-6: ^every year, thousands of salmon swim upstream in what is known as a salmon run.
g-7: ^this time, you heed the call of the waters.

continue_narration: ^you don't know, because you are a fish.

g-1: ^Most salmon return to the river in which they spawned.

c-2: ^ You remember that it was a lively place. The area was full of life. You played in the stream, and there was so much to explore. You enjoyed being with everyone. But since then, you have all been separated.
c-3: ^ You remember it being a peaceful place. You lived without fear of predators. You lived blissfully with the other fish, and every day was full of happiness. But you haven't experienced that since then.
c-4: ^ You don't like to think about it.

g-4: ^it's awfully quiet on the open ocean. you are too tired to think about such serious things.
g-5: ^you'd better get going if you want to make it.

ocean1: ^You are now freed from the narrative text. You swim around freely and explore.

s0: ^Squawk! The seagull swipes at you, nearly missing. Scary.

s: ^You see a fish and talk to them.
^You see a fish and talk to them.

c-0: ^Hello there! Are you headed to the estuary?
^Me too! Before we go, do you want to see something cool?
^You follow the fish and swim to a new area.

c-1: ^Okay...but just so you know, all of the other salmon are going there right now.
^Are you ready to go now? You're going to be late.
^The fish looks upset at you, as much as a fish can emote.

s: ^You see a coral reef, waving at you with their elongated round body.

g-1: ^Hey hey hey, you are new here.

c-1: ^You know, it gets lonely down here. Every year, I meet so many of you...
^So many of me? What do yo mean?
^Oh, I meant, so many of whom who looks exactly like you, and swim towards the exact destination.

s: ^You want to ask them another question.

c-1: ^Have you ever been there? You know, the estuary?
^Oh boy, I have not, and I find it interesting that I have been here forever, but I have never met any salmon heading back from the estuary...
^I wonder why that's the case.. Did they decide to stay there forever because of how beautiful it is?
^I do not know my friend, but I hope that is the case. I hope the best for you.

c-2: ^Well, welcome back. Isn't this place mesmerizing?

s: ^Yes, and I want to know more about the estuary.
^Yes, and I am just here to listen to you rambling on life.

c-0: ^I would love to tell you more about it, but I just have never heard anything from any salmon who actually went there and came back. I'm so sorry.
c-1: ^Somedays I doubt if I will be happier if I can swim. You know, us coral reefs live long long lives, between 5,000 and 10,000 years old. We see the same views everyday. But I know for a fact that just by being here, I'm helping the lives of other sea plants, and that makes my life meaningful. I don't have to have a impressive destination to get to. I am comfortable being where I am because that is what I want.

s: ^That's wonderful to hear. But you know, some of us just gotta go to places...
^That's intersting to hear. Sometimes I think about if I actually want to go to the estuary...

c-0: ^But is that what you actually want? For yourself?

s: ^I don't know... That was a lovely talk... But I have to head back now.

west: ^You come across a pair of sea horses
^they talk to you about their relationship and life with their children
south: ^You swim to the south but something feels wrong. The water is dark and rapid. You feel that you are going the wrong way. In the depths, you catch glimpses of shifting shadows and unblinking eyes.

struggle: ^You struggle in the water but make little progress.
death: ^The journey was just too much for you. You died, never knowing what the future could hold.
earlyend: ^You swim out over the horizon, leaving your past life behind.
^Many days pass. There seems to be no end in sight.
^In the distance, you see some shimmering on the surface of the water.

s: ^*Triumphant music* You find a piece of plastic. Disgusting. But its shiny white surface...it beckons.

c-0: ^You have no self control and took the plastic. You are now literally carrying trash around. You feel kind of silly.
c-1: ^You eat the forbidden fruit, in a humorous mood.
c-2: ^It's gross so you left it alone.

b: ^ *Triumphant music* You find some shrimp. Tasty.

c-0: ^You take the shrimp. You save it as a snack for later.
c-1: ^You eat the shrimp. You feel invigorated.

vegan_seagull: ^You see another seagull. You make eye contact.

s0: ^I'm vegan. It's better for the environment.
s1: ^ It reduces CO2 emissions and saves water.
s2: ^ Do you want to know more? Cryptocurrency and NFTs are also terrible.
s3: ^ I don't know what else to say. Go look it up.

sunrise: ^You see a beautiful sunrise. A firey light spills out over the horizon and engulfs the ocean. It is breathtaking.

c-0: ^It's where the river meets the sea.
g-0: ^There are lots of fish here, mulling around the waters. You can feel the energy in the air. The waves pulse with bodies flowing and shifting, the unmistakable glint of fish scales.

estuaryfish: ^There are so many fish to talk to!

salmon1dialogue: ^I don't want to be a downer, but not everyone will make the journey.
^I wonder what's up there, that everyone wants so bad?
salmon2dialogue: ^I heard you can see the stars up there.
^They say they glisten brighter than any scale.
salmon3dialogue: ^I heard the water is crisp and pure...
^The ocean has given me the creeps, ever since that one incident...
^do you think it'll be high enough there to see the sea in the sky?
^do you think they can see us? haha sorry, that was random. I've just been thinking too much, I guess.
salmon4dialogue: ^I heard they can grant any one wish for the salmon who get to the top...what should I wish for, I wonder?
salmon5dialogue: ^A right of passage for our species, if you will.
^You youngsters should take this more seriously. It's not a game.
salmon6dialogue: ^Lets go! I'm so pumped for this!!
salmon7dialogue: ^i'm coming along to support my friends.
^I don't really care about the treasure or wishes that are up there
^but don't tell them i said that
salmon8dialogue: ^It's like we're setting out on an adventure!
salmon10dialogue: ^I'm going to make it first. I've trained my whole life for this.
salmon11dialogue: ^if i received the wish i would become a baker
^i'd open a small neighborhood bakery with little flower planters on the windowsill
^the smell of fresh baked bread every morning

c-0: ^They don't seem to hear you. You are left to imagine what this mystical bakery is.
^It sounds nice, though. You hope you get to experience it one day.

salmon12dialogue: ^i heard theres a BIG treasure buried upstream.
salmon13dialogue: ^when salmon run, it's like we're swimming as one!
salmon14dialogue: ^what they DONT WANT YOU TO KNOW
^there's a big new-age fish society in the mountains
salmon15dialogue: ^I want to be the first in fishkind to make a map of this river!
salmon16dialogue: ^If I can get to the top, maybe I can be someone, you know?

rock: ^If you could be any object, what would you be?

c-0: ^Lucky you! It's nice to meet someone who's happy with who they are.
c-1: ^Yeah, being able to fly would be neat.

i_would_be: ^For me, I would be a rock.

c-0: ^Are we any less alone out here? Tell me, did you ever have any meanintful interactions with any of the fish in this river?
^Well...maybe times have changed. There is hope for us after all.
c-1: ^See, I'm right. There is no meaning. All we can do is swim.

^As fish, we have too many responsibilities, too many choices. I just want to be able to sit in this river and do nothing. I want to take a break and take in the beautiful scenery. Doesn't that sound like freedom to you?
c-2: ^I would get to see all the beautiful scenery and watch the fish and the days go by, sitting peacefully in the river. That doesn't sound so bad, doesn't it.

c-1: ^Yeah...I want to sit and watch the days go by, in the midst of nature. Not a thought in this head.

c-0: ^Yeah, it's been quite some time since we last met.
c-1: ^Ah, nevermind. I must have confused you with another fish.

continued: ^Ah, I'm not sure what it was... those days seem so far away.
^I was so naive at the time. They were just faraway dreams. I didn't know how to be serious. You and I, we need to focus on what's realistic.

c-0: ^See? You understand. There's no time for trivial matters. We must fulfill our duties first.

bear: ^A bear stands in the middle of the river, swiping its paw in the current, catching poor unsuspecting fish. You have to be careful.

c-0: ^The bear's fat paw catches you right in the gills, knocking the air out of you. It's all over.
^Why are you carrying literal garbage? You're disgusting!! Are you trying to kill me?

overlook: ^You get to swim into a small area along the edge of the cliff and look at the scenery and how far you've come.
salmon17again3: ^They are too busy swimming to talk.
salmon17again4: ^I'm tired now. That took a lot out of me.
salmon18dialogue: ^I don't know if I'm cut out for this...
salmon19dialogue: ^Don't you think it's cool that we're one of the few species of animals that can do this? It's our destiny!
specialdialogue: ^Wow, you talked to so many fish here! Aren't you worried you won't make it upstream in time? You'll be left behind!
specialdialogue2: ^You can call me Sam for short.
specialdialogue3: ^Do you ever procrastinate on making a big decision by doing anything and everything else?
specialdialogue4: ^I want to see it for myself.

g-4: ^Oh, shellfish, selfish, whatever. I don't know...I think I ought to do it. It's a once in a lifetime opportunity after all. And it's nice to know I'll have a friend when I get there.
g-5: ^You're glad too. Maybe you did find something on this journey after all.

c-1:
^You swim around but do not see them.

^You ask some of the fish but they haven't seen them either.

branching: ^You notice a fork in the river. Your instincts scream that this is the wrong way. Do you take it?

c-0: ^You wonder if you've made the right choice.

s: ^Yes, I made this decision for myself.

c-1: ^You do not take the path, feeling a bit relieved.

cont: ^Either way, you are not turning back.
^You swim down the winding path, observing nature all around you.
^It's quiet out here, without the rest of the salmon.
^The tree leaves fall and create ripples. Bugs skitter across the surface of the water. You've never seen something like this before.
^At night, you lie in the river, staring up at the sky.
^You feel the strength draining from your bones. You know that you don't have much time left.
^You reflect on your journey. Flashbacks to the scenes of your journey.

c-0: ^You drift in the current as the camera zooms out.
^You can't help but wonder what was at the top of the stream.

weak: ^The longer we stay in freshwater, the weaker we get.

g-0: ^You start to question if you are really ready for this? You've come all this way, but is this goal you've been working towards really what you want?

lake: ^You did it! You reached the top of the stream, in the mountains. What will you do now?

c-2: ^You don't feel like you belong here. You turn back.
c-3: ^You don't feel like you belong here. You turn back.

c-0: ^It's great to see you guys back.
g-0: ^Oh yeah. You leave and then come back every year.

s: ^You know, I get to make a wish or something?

g-1: ^The real treasure is the nature surrounding us! The magical phenomenon of life and rebirth!

s: ^Umm that's cool and all but everyone told me they were looking for something here...

g-1: ^That's for you to discover for yourself. I can't help you there.

Coginthemachine: ^You see salmon going through the whole process of finding a mate, but you notice another lone salmon off to the side. You swim up to them.

g-1: ^do you ever wonder, why we're here in the first place?

hopeful: ^to be honest, i'm not sure why i made it all this way.
^i mean, i came along because everyone else made it out to be a big deal, but it turns out i never knew what i was looking for in the first place, even now that i'm here.

g-5: ^...Hey um now that we made it should we do that whole reproduction thing?

cog: ^oh ok....well lets just do that whole reproduction thing
Thefriendswemadealongtheway: ^You go back and pass by the friends you made on your trip. You reminisce of the conversations you had along the way. You wonder what was waiting for you at the Lake, but does it really matter? You're happy now and thats all that matters.
regrets: ^You turn back, hesitant. As you swim downstream, the scene flashes by you. What was it all for? You wonder if you could have done more.
reproduced: ^You did it, you fulfilled your wordly obligation. But you don't feel satisfied. Is this it? Is this all there is to the world? You think back on your journey.

^ No, it's not. You think about all the hopes and dreams of the salmon. They are worthwhile. They do mean something, and they mean something to you. You are too tired to swim any longer, and stare up at the twinkling stars.
^ You think about the masses of fish swimming through the river as you float listlessly in the water, surrounded by darkness. The roaring sound of waves, the sound of nothingness...
